document.docAuthor: Pacheco-Chaves, Bernald, Cordeiro, Isabelle Da Rocha Silva, Moreira, Felipe Ferraz Figueiredo & Springer, Monika
document.masterDocTitle: The water striders (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Gerridae) of Costa Rica: new species, checklist, and new records

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The water striders (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Gerridae) of Costa Rica: new species, checklist, and new records

bibRefCitation.refString: Hungerford, H. B. (1932) A new Platygerris with notes on P. caeruleus Champion (Gerridae). Bulletin of the Brooklyn Entomological Society, 27, 178 - 182.

subSubSection.paragraph:
This species is known only from Costa Rica , with previous records from Alajuela and San José provinces, and the Virilla River ( Hungerford 1932 , 1939 ; Matsuda 1961b ). It is herein reported for the first time from Cartago , Guanacaste , Heredia , Limón , and Puntarenas provinces.
Platygerris asymmetricus
is usually found on the riffles of lotic habitats, but has also been collected on slow flowing areas. It occurs on both the Atlantic and Pacific slopes, up to 2,406 m a.s.l.
